comments.body: Do you mean it has `LOGICAL_PLAN_INHERITED_TAG` but doesn't have `LOGICAL_PLAN_TAG`?
Otherwise, retaining the logical plan link should mean `LOGICAL_PLAN_TAG` or `LOGICAL_PLAN_INHERITED_TAG` is set. Why we need to make sure it set again?

> Do you mean it has LOGICAL_PLAN_INHERITED_TAG but doesn't have LOGICAL_PLAN_TAG?

Yes. `LOGICAL_PLAN_TAG` is kind of stronger than logical plan link (which means either LOGICAL_PLAN_TAG or LOGICAL_PLAN_INHERITED_TAG is set).
Can we add a comment here to explain the `PhysicalOperation` pattern?
The comment above covers this case right?

      case FilterExec(_, d: DataSourceV2ScanExecBase) if !d.supportsColumnar => false
      case _ =>
        if (requireOrdering) {
